description: Enforcement Directorate conducted raids at 23 locations in Jharkhand, targeting the relatives of a minister and an IAS officer over allegations of financial irregularities in the implementation of the Jal Jeevan Mission. Political tensions rise as JMM and BJP exchange allegations of vendetta and pressure tactics.
title: ED raids Jharkhand mantri’s brother, PA; BJP’s poll prep says Hemant Soren
Mass arson during funeral of man killed in Bahraich clashes

description: In Chhattisgarh's Surajpur town, a head constable's wife and daughter were murdered, allegedly by a notorious criminal who previously attacked police. The suspect, Kuldeep Sahu, is still at large, prompting anger and protests from locals, who torched his house and clashed with authorities.
title: Criminal kills cop’s wife, daughter in Chhattisgarh, mob burns down his house

description: Indian diplomats in Canada are accused by the RCMP of collecting intelligence for targeting the South Asian community, linked to the Hardeep Singh Nijjar murder. Allegations include use of coercion and threats by Indian agents and ties with organized crime. India denies receiving evidence from Canada to substantiate these claims.
title: Indian diplomats collected info that was used to target South Asians, say RCMP

description: India recalled its high commissioner and six diplomats from Canada, alleging that Canadian actions endanger their safety. The expulsion follows a diplomatic rift over allegations linking Indian diplomats to the murder of pro-Khalistani separatist Hardeep Singh Nijjar. India decries the allegations as politically motivated and baseless.
title: India recalls its envoy, other diplomats as Canada links them to Nijjar murder

description: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's increasing confrontations with India align with his declining popularity at home. Facing criticism over rising living costs, healthcare, and crime, alongside political challenges, Trudeau courts the influential Sikh community ahead of elections. Bilateral ties worsened after Trudeau accused Indian agents of killing terrorist Hardeep Singh Nijjar, straining diplomatic relations further.
title: Justin Trudeau's offensive a pre-poll ploy amid waning support

description: Two suspects in the murder of former state minister Baba Siddique have revealed plans to also kill his son, Congress MLA Zeeshan Siddique, if he was present. Zeeshan had previously sought increased security due to threats. Police are investigating the motive and reviewing connections, including possible links to jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi.
title: Baba Siddique suspects say were told to kill son too

description: Early Monday morning, tensions flared in Secunderabad after a man from a minority community damaged an idol in a local temple. Locals apprehended and assaulted him before he was taken to a hospital in critical condition. Police are investigating the incident and seeking motives.
title: Idol vandalised at Secunderabad temple, intruder beaten up

description: Punjab and Haryana High Court has ruled that military pensioners should receive benefits from their discharge date, not from the date of a court order. This decision came after Jaspal Singh, a former Army serviceman, challenged an earlier order. The court stated Singh deserved pension from his discharge date with 7% annual interest.
title: Pension to ex-servicemen apply from date of discharge: HC

description: Bombay HC has reserved its decision on a plea by Shiv Sena (UBT) against the withdrawal of 12 MLC nominations from 2020. Meanwhile, the Mahayuti government has sent 7 new names for approval. Controversy arises as the EC code of conduct looms and legal challenges from Sena (UBT) are expected.
title: HC order on UBT plea reserved, but governor clears Mahayuti govt's 7 MLC picks

description: The Supreme Court has declined to entertain a plea against the LG of J&K's authority to nominate five assembly members, advising the petitioner to seek redress in the High Court. Senior advocate Abhishek Manu Singhvi raised concerns about the potential negation of electoral mandates, but the bench noted the LG had not yet exercised this power.
title: Supreme Court junks plea on J&K LG’s MLA picks, suggests HC route
Austrailia offers work & holiday visa for Indians under 30

description: The Indian Army has secured contracts worth Rs 65 crore with three civil aviation firms for the first time to deliver logistical support to 44 forward posts in J&K and Ladakh during winter when these areas become inaccessible due to snowfall. This move aims to help sustain critical posts using civil helicopters, conserving military choppers for crucial operations.
title: Army to use civil helicopters for logistical support

description: The Supreme Court declined to entertain a plea urging the creation of laws punishing non-consensual unnatural sex, stating it falls within Parliament's legislative duties. Despite previous judgments creating offences, the bench emphasized its inability to compel legislative action. A contrasting Delhi High Court ruling had sought similar provisions in the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, urging prompt government action.
title: Can’t ask Parliament to create BNS equivalent of Sec 377: Supreme Court

description: Mumbai police crime branch seeks exemption under CrPC 268 to attain custody of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who has been detained in Sabarmati Jail on various charges including murder and extortion. Despite hurdles, the Centre has extended the remand order for another year.
title: CrPC 268 (1) stops transfer of Bishnoi from Gujarat jail to Mumbai
Opposition MPs walk out of JPC meeting on Waqf Bill

description: A potential oversight by Mumbai police in not thoroughly investigating Shubham Lonkar, a suspect in the Salman Khan shooting case, might have led to the killing of Baba Siddique. Lonkar, connected to the Bishnoi gang, allegedly recruited new shooters and claimed responsibility for Siddique's murder.
title: Baba Siddique murder: Shubham quizzed in Salman firing case in May, but let off

description: India will sign a $3.3 billion deal with the US for 31 weaponised MQ-9B Predator drones, enhancing its strategic ISR and precision strike capabilities, particularly in the Indian Ocean Region. Deliveries and assembly in India will commence within four years. The deal, cleared by the PM-led security panel, also includes a global MRO facility in India.
title: India, US to ink Predator deal today

description: BJP intensified its offensive against Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge, demanding his resignation after his family returned five acres of state-owned land. BJP spokesperson Sudhansu Trivedi accused Congress leaders of being involved in multiple land scams, portraying the party as a group of property dealers.
title: Congress brass obsessed with land-grab, must quit: BJP
Assam undertrial prisoner found dead in water body after jailbreak

description: The Centre assured Punjab's government of procuring all 184 lakh tonnes of approved paddy without any restrictions. Union food minister Pralhad Joshi and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann discussed challenges and solutions related to paddy procurement, storage, and miller issues, including arhtiya commission restoration.
title: Will buy entire stock of paddy, Centre assures Punjab government

description: Delhi High Court admonished Wikipedia for refusing to reveal user information in a defamation case filed by a news agency. The bench warned Wikipedia could lose its safe harbour privilege and be blocked in India if it doesn't comply with the law. The court demanded the removal of defamatory edits, stressing user anonymity cannot shield defamatory content.
title: High court warns Wikipedia for bid to put pressure on judge

description: Congress has accused the Punjab government, led by Bhagwant Mann, of colluding with the BJP to create a paddy storage crisis, potentially damaging the state's economy. Leader Partap Singh Bajwa claimed this could cause substantial losses and alleged a conspiracy to force farmers into distress sales, benefiting industrialists like Adani. Immediate intervention from the Centre was urged.
title: Haryana elections: Ties worsen as Congress claims AAP-BJP plot for farm crisis

description: The Indian government has approved a 50% increase in the ceiling prices of several essential drugs used to treat various conditions, due to increased costs and unviability issues. The National Pharmaceutical Pricing Authority invoked extraordinary powers to ensure the continued availability of these crucial medicines.
title: Thalassaemia, TB, asthma drug prices set to rise

description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau accused India of conducting activities that jeopardize public safety, including clandestine operations against South Asian Canadians. Trudeau highlighted Canada's unsuccessful attempts to collaborate with India and announced the expulsion of six Canadian diplomats following the allegations. The Indian government refuted these claims, recalling its High Commissioner from Canada in response.
title: Canada PM Trudeau accuses India of 'covert ops, coercion, threats' amid row

description: RBI governor Shaktikanta Das has warned of risks associated with excessive reliance on AI and machine learning in banking, highlighting potential market concentration, systemic instability, and increased cyber vulnerabilities. He urged banks to implement adequate risk mitigation measures. Das also proposed expanding India's real-time gross settlement system to include major trade currencies like the dollar, euro, and pound.
title: Unchecked use of AI in banking poses risk: RBI governor

description: Four police officers in Bijnor were suspended for negligence after a 19-year-old, accused of eloping with a minor, was found dead at an investigating officer's house. The deceased's family alleges foul play, questioning the circumstances of the death and accusing the police and the girl's family of murder.
title: Teen elopes with minor, found dead at cop's house

description: Two years after Congress councillor Tapan Kandu's murder in Purulia, his widow Purnima Kandu also died under mysterious circumstances. Declared dead upon arrival at a health center, an unnatural death case has been lodged. Family members allege 'slow poisoning.' A CBI inquiry has been demanded for an impartial investigation.
title: Widow of slain Bengal Congress neta found dead

description: The Supreme Court dismissed a PIL seeking an investigation into alleged side effects of the Covishield vaccine, developed by AstraZeneca and Oxford and produced by Serum Institute of India. The petitioner demanded compensation for affected families and a review of the Covid vaccine policy. The bench emphasized that vaccines helped manage the pandemic and urged against sensationalizing the issue.
title: Supreme Court bins pleas for probe into Covid jab side-effects

description: The Supreme Court upheld the decision by the UP BJP government to cancel the 2012 land lease to Maulana Mohd Ali Jauhar Trust, calling it a misuse of power by founder trustee Azam Khan. The court noted the education department should ensure students' rights are protected.
title: 'Gross misuse of power': SC on SP government's land lease to Azam Khan's trust

description: Bangladesh's interim government criticized India's assertions about attacks on Hindus and temple desecration, labeling them as baseless and exaggerated. Authorities assured prompt corrective measures in reported cases and highlighted the peaceful observance of Durga Puja at over 32,000 venues. Investigations continue regarding the theft of a gold-plated crown.
title: Delhi assertions about hits on Hindus 'uncalled for': Dhaka

description: CM Eknath Shinde's cabinet has decided to permanently waive tolls for LMVs, state transport, and school buses at Mumbai's five entry points, with the loss of Rs 800 crore to be paid to the contractor upfront. Over 3.5 lakh vehicles cross these toll booths every day.
title: Ahead of polls, toll waived for LMVs at Mumbai entry points
'Third assassination attempt' on Trump turns out to be a dud story amid post-rally fiasco

description: Starting January, the Indian government will mandate hallmarking for all gold bullion, including imports, ensuring adherence to purity standards. Exceptions will be made for bullion used by jewellers for their own productions. Current assaying and hallmarking centres will be used for verification.
title: Hallmarking gold bullion likely to be mandatory from next year

description: Nearly a third of positions at the National Company Law Tribunal remain unfilled, impacting the government's insolvency reform initiative. This shortage has led to operational inefficiencies, delaying insolvency resolutions significantly. The average resolution time has surged to 716 days, far exceeding the 270-day deadline, posing challenges for corporate insolvency processes.
title: Only 13 of 30 National Company Law Tribunal courts work full time

description: Retail inflation in New Delhi rose to a 9-month high of 5.5% in September, driven by a sharp increase in food prices like vegetables, edible oils, and pulses. This surge in inflation dampens hopes for an interest rate cut, despite the RBI's recent policy shift to a neutral stance.
title: At 5.5%, retail inflation in September rises to a 9-month high

description: After a thriving post-Covid period, the Indian car industry faces a downturn as wholesales to dealerships drop by 2% in Q2 FY25. Despite hefty discounts, buyers remain cautious, and the festive period fails to boost volumes significantly. Industry growth is now predicted to remain below 5% for the year, reflecting a market slowdown.
title: After 3 years of bumper sales, car companies lower forecast

description: Rahul Kharge, son of Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge, withdrew his request for land allotment in Bengaluru amid controversies involving Congress leadership. The BJP accused the party of corruption and land-grabbing, pointing to past allegations, including against Robert Vadra. Prominent Congress figures are embroiled in various land-related scandals, adding to the party's woes.
title: BJP's 'Bhu Daan to Bhu Harap' charge: Has Congress 'land'ed in trouble again?

description: Pakistan fail to capitalize on strong bowling against New Zealand by collapsing to a record-low total of 56, resulting in their elimination from the Women's T20 World Cup. New Zealand secures a semifinal spot alongside Australia with a dominant victory.
title: 5 wickets for 4 runs! Pakistan's epic collapse ends India's journey

description: MAGA Republican Trump and Democratic candidate Harris escalated their verbal attacks, challenging each other's mental fitness while avoiding direct confrontational interviews. Trump refused to release full medical records, while Harris maintained her physical fitness. Trump's criticisms extend to a controversial biopic, fueling tensions ahead of the November election.
title: Don and Kamala taunt each others mental fitness

description: Junior doctors in Kolkata marched to Raj Bhavan, meeting Governor CV Ananda Bose, to demand a thorough CBI investigation into their colleague's rape and murder at RG Kar Hospital, rejecting the current charge sheet. The protest, beginning on October 5, has drawn widespread support.
title: RG Kar case: Docs submit memo to Bengal guv

description: A Delhi court is set to give its verdict on the bail plea of Independent MP Engineer Rashid related to a 2017 terror funding case. Rashid, who has been in Tihar jail since 2019, was previously granted interim bail to campaign for the J&K Assembly elections. He has a significant political presence, having garnered substantial votes in past elections.
title: Delhi court to decide on Engineer Rashid's regular bail plea on October 15

description: China has significantly reduced its dependence on US-sourced helium, a critical resource for technology sectors like semiconductors and healthcare. By diversifying imports, notably from Qatar and Russia, and advancing domestic production through technology, Beijing has enhanced its helium supply security. Despite progress, imports still constitute a substantial portion of China's helium consumption.
title: How China is lessening its reliance on helium sourced from US

description: Afghanistan's Taliban has announced a gradual ban on news media publishing images of living beings, citing Islamic law. While full enforcement is pending, some provinces have started adapting. Media professionals face increased restrictions, and the media workforce has significantly declined since the Taliban took power.
title: New on Taliban's ban list, this time for media: No photos of living things

description: Baba Siddique, a former Maharashtra minister, was assassinated with six gunshots outside his son Zeeshan's office in Mumbai. Suspects, including two from Uttar Pradesh and one from Haryana, were arrested. The search for the mastermind and other culprits continues, as security and political reactions escalate.
title: Siddique murder case: Top developments

description: New Zealand's 54-run win over Pakistan in Dubai secured their spot in the Women's T20 World Cup semifinals and knocked India out of the tournament. Despite Pakistan's efforts to contain New Zealand to 110 for six, their batting collapsed, getting all out for 56. New Zealand secured their first semi-final spot since 2016.
title: Women's T20 WC: India eliminated after NZ beat Pak to enter semis

description: Amid accusations by Canada implicating India's high commissioner in an "ongoing investigation", India firmly rejected these claims as politically motivated. This latest development further strains Indo-Canadian relations, already troubled since Trudeau's allegations last year and historical tensions dating back to the 1980s.
title: Why the Trudeaus have had difficult relations with India

description: India's investigative team is visiting the US to discuss allegations of a plot to assassinate a Khalistani separatist in New York. The US State Department has issued a statement on the case, and India's enquiry committee will probe further linkages. India's embassy has not commented on the team's arrival amid tense US-Canada relations.
title: Pannun case: Indian inquiry team to reach US, probe 'foiled plot'

description: The Delhi High Court criticized Wikipedia for refusing to reveal users' identities in a defamation case brought by ANI. The court questioned Wikipedia's role and warned it could lose its intermediary protection. Wikipedia was also reprimanded for potentially interfering with sub-judice matters through a dedicated page on the case, with removal instructions pending by Wednesday.
title: Delhi HC to Wikipedia: You may be world’s powerful entity but ...

description: The Kerala assembly unanimously passes a resolution against the central government for delaying financial aid for Wayanad's landslide rehabilitation. The CPI(M)-led LDF and opposition UDF criticize PM Modi for not allocating funds despite his widely covered visit. The state demands at least Rs 2000 crore.
title: Kerala passes resolution against Centre's delayed aid for Wayanad

description: Wipro unveiled its new hybrid work policy, expecting employees to work from the office three days a week with an option for remote work on certain days. Chief HR Officer Saurabh Govil described this as a modern and inclusive approach, emphasizing collaboration, flexibility, and support for special needs while maintaining a high-performance culture.
title: Wipro makes 3-days work from office mandatory: Read HR head's email

description: Rahul Kharge, son of Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge, withdrew his request for land allotment in Bengaluru amid controversies involving Congress leadership. The BJP accused the party of corruption and land-grabbing, pointing to past allegations, including against Robert Vadra. Prominent Congress figures are embroiled in various land-related scandals, adding to the party's woes.
title: BJP's 'Bhu Daan to Bhu Harap' charge: Has Congress 'land'ed in trouble again?
Diplomatic showdown: India expels 6 Canadian diplomats

description: Nasser Hussain criticized Pakistan cricket’s management, pointing to instability and lack of planning as core issues behind their struggles. He highlighted constant changes in selectors, coaches, and captains, arguing this hinders success. Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram hinted at agreement. Pakistan make four changes for the second Test against England in Multan.
title: 'The issue is not Babar, Shaheen...': Hussain rips into Pak cricket
Pannun case: Indian inquiry team to reach US on Oct 15 to probe 'foiled plot'

description: Reliance Industries Ltd, led by Mukesh Ambani, reported a 5% decrease in consolidated net profit for Q2 FY25, standing at Rs 16,563 crore. Revenue from operations slightly increased by 0.2% YoY to Rs 2.35 lakh crore, while EBITDA fell by 2% and finance costs rose by 5%.
title: RIL Q2 results: Reliance Industries reports 5% fall in net profit

description: India bans import of pocket lighter parts to cut dependence on Chinese goods and boost local production. The DGFT's restrictions aim to curb substandard product inflow and reduce the trade deficit with China, aligning with the broader strategy of promoting self-sufficiency.
title: Government has announced these 'Chinese restrictions' on pocket lighters

description: External affairs minister S Jaishankar urges nations to employ Indian talent, highlighting global demand for skilled workers. Launching the eMigrate V2.0 portal, he stresses India's commitment to safe migration and improved labor mobility, emphasizing technological integration and streamlined processes for better workforce access.
title: 'Turn towards...' : Jaishankar promotes Indian talent to friendly nations

description: Former India batter Aakash Chopra humorously engages with a troll after commenting on the Pakistan Cricket Board's decision to rest key players Babar Azam, Shaheen Afridi, and Naseem Shah. Chopra subtly mocks the PCB's clarification, leading to a witty exchange involving cricket oversights.
title: Aakash Chopra shuts down troll with savage reply

description: Veteran actor Atul Parchure, known for his roles in The Kapil Sharma Show, passed away on October 14 at the age of 57. He had been battling cancer for the past few years.
title: Seasoned actor Atul Parchure passes away at 57

description: Omar Abdullah is preparing to take oath as Jammu & Kashmir's chief minister on October 16. President's rule was recently lifted, allowing the formation of a new government. Abdullah, supported by the National Conference-Congress alliance and several Independents, was elected as the NC legislature leader, marking his second term in office from a coalition with Congress.
title: J&K govt formation: Omar Abdullah to take oath as CM on October 16

description: Diplomatic tensions rise as India withdraws High Commissioner and diplomats from Canada, citing safety concerns and rejecting Trudeau's baseless allegations linking Indian agents to a Canadian citizen's murder. India condemns Canada’s investigation, calling it politically motivated vote bank politics.
title: 'We have no faith in ...': India withdraws High Commissioner, some diplomats from Canada

description: John Cena's wrestling reign includes 16 world titles, overshadowing Roman Reigns' six. However, Reigns' dominance in the ring is evident through his recent 1,316-day championship and undefeated record against Cena in singles matches. Despite Cena's massive social media presence and global fame, even he acknowledges Roman Reigns as potentially the greatest wrestler ever.
title: John Cena vs Roman Reigns: Who won the most WWE titles?

description: Mayank Yadav made a sharp debut in the T20I series against Bangladesh, claiming 4 wickets in 3 matches. Notably, he became the fourth bowler in T20I history to take a wicket with the first ball of an innings. He is now named as a traveling reserve for India's upcoming Test series against New Zealand.
title: Talk about wrapping Mayank Yadav in cotton wool is exaggerated: Ex-selector

description: The Nigerian national football team was stranded for over 12 hours at Al Abraq International Airport in Libya, without food or water, just 24 hours before their key African Cup of Nations qualifiers match against Libya. The situation arose after their plane was unexpectedly rerouted, leaving the team without proper arrangements to reach Benghazi.
title: Premier League star Ndidi claims hostage situation in Libya

description: India's head coach Gautam Gambhir supports a 'high risk, high reward' strategy in Test cricket, emphasizing aggressive play despite potential low scores. He stresses adaptability and growth, indicating a focus on aggressive yet flexible tactics. The immediate challenge is the Test series against New Zealand, with respect but no fear for the opponents.
title: 'High risk, high reward, high risk, high...': Gambhir's mantra

description: Salman Khan tightens security following Baba Siddique's assassination by Lawrence Bishnoi's gang. Ram Gopal Varma's tweets about the incident spark online debates. Ranbir Kapoor shares wedding insights, while Kriti Sanon's 'Do Patti' trailer impresses. Adah Sharma moves into Sushant Singh Rajput's flat, defending her decision amid criticism.
title: After Siddique's demise, Salman Khan asked not to accept visitors: Top 5 news
'Panel not functioning as per rules': Oppn MPs boycott JPC on Waqf bil

description: Congress has condemned the honoring of two men accused of murdering journalist Gauri Lankesh in 2017, who were released on bail. The Congress party stated that saffron symbolizes courage and sacrifice, while the right-wing group responsible said the men were unfairly imprisoned.
title: Congress slams felicitation of Gauri Lankesh murder accused

description: To combat Aadhaar-based fraud, UIDAI has launched Masked Aadhaar, which hides the first eight digits with 'X's, enhancing privacy and reducing misuse. Masked Aadhaar are easily available for download in a password-protected PDF format from website and is equally valid as other Aadhaar formats. This measure addresses fraud using Aadhaar-linked payments.
title: What is Masked Aadhaar & why you should use it only for KYC or as ID proof

description: Scammers in India are increasingly using innovative tactics, including AI, to target victims through fake employment offers, digital arrest threats, and fraudulent schemes. Over 9.5 lakh complaints were filed in early 2024, with Rs 1,750 crore lost. Be alert to scams involving fake authorities, stock trading schemes, and fraudulent KYC updates.
title: Don’t fall prey to these scams! 10 ways in which scamsters can fraud you

description: Dr S Somanath, secretary of India's Department of Space and Isro chairman, received the 2024 IAF World Space Award for the successful Chandrayaan-3 mission. The  International Astronautical Federation acknowledged India's advancements in lunar exploration, marking the first landing near the lunar South Pole. Celebrations for the achievement were held in Milan.
title: Isro receives IAF World Space Award for Chandrayaan-3

description: Brad Hogg criticized the comparison between Babar Azam’s current slump and Virat Kohli’s past struggles, labeling it as 'baseless.' Hogg highlighted differences in team performance during their respective slumps, while Fakhar Zaman emphasized supporting star players. Babar was dropped after poor performances, failing to score above fifty in his last 18 Test innings.
title: 'Baseless': Fakhar's Kohli vs Babar comparison slammed
Renukaswamy murder: Actor Darshan & Pavithra Gowda's bail plea rejected

description: Protesting doctors in New Delhi met with Bengal chief secretary Manoj Pant, expressing dissatisfaction as their 'fast-onto-death' strike entered its 10th day. Pant assured that the state government was addressing seven out of ten demands, but couldn't provide a timeline for the remaining three.
title: 'Zero results': Bengal govt-doctors meet fails to resolve RG Kar impasse

description: India summoned Canada's charge d'affaires, Stewart Wheeler, challenging Canada's decision to probe Indian diplomats over links to a Khalistani terrorist's assassination. India labeled Trudeau's allegations as baseless and politically motivated, accusing him of exploiting anti-India rhetoric for domestic political gains.
title: India summons Canadian diplomat after Trudeau's 'preposterous' allegations

description: In Surajpur district, Chhattisgarh, a history-sheeter killed the wife and daughter of police head constable Talib Sheikh after a failed attempt to run him over. The bodies were found with sharp weapon injuries. The incident sparked local unrest, with angry residents vandalising the suspect's home.
title: Mob attacks SDM after criminal kills cop's family, dumps heads 4 km away

description: N Chandrasekaran shares a heartfelt LinkedIn tribute to Ratan Tata, emphasizing Tata’s humanity, meticulous attention to detail, and unwavering care for employees and animals. Chandrasekaran recounts instances that highlight Tata's dedication, such as resolving employee wage disputes and renovating Bombay House with provisions for the resident dogs.
title: When Tata Sons chairman N Chandrasekaran was told: 'Mr Tata would not like it ...'

description: Diwali 2024 is celebrated on October 31, amidst a series of vibrant festivities. Key rituals span from Dhanteras on October 29, including prayers to Goddess Laxmi and offering of lights. The celebration concludes with Bhai Dooj on November 3, highlighting the brother-sister bond. Detailed timings for pujas and muhurats are provided.
title: Diwali 2024 Calendar: What are the 5 Days of Diwali? know here

description: Shooter Arjun Babuta expresses confidence after narrowly missing a medal at the Paris Olympics. Now focusing on ISSF World Cup Final 2024 in New Delhi, he aims to refine his strategy for future Olympic success. The Indian team includes top shooters and is ranked fifth in the ISSF World Cup series.
title: EXCLUSIVE: 'I have it in me, I am very strong to win medals'
Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray admitted to HN Reliance Hospital

description: Hyundai IPO: Hyundai Motor India plans to raise capital through an OFS, reducing Hyundai Motor Company's stake to 82.5%. With a focus on new model launches and capacity expansion, the company aims to boost growth despite losing market share to competitors like Maruti.
title: Hyundai India’s IPO opens tomorrow - here’s what investors need to know

description: Chief minister M K Stalin has appealed to IT firms to instruct employees to work from home between Oct 15 and 18.
title: Tamil Nadu rain: Holiday declared for schools and colleges in these districts

description: The upcoming Border Gavaskar Trophy features a key clash between Australia's Mitchell Starc and India's Virat Kohli, with Kohli having dominated their past Test encounters. Starc appreciates his battles with Kohli and praised India coach Gautam Gambhir's strategic brilliance and team spirit. Gambhir's new tenure faces a significant test as the series begins soon.
title: I enjoy my battles with Virat Kohli, says Mitchell Starc

description: Daron Acemoglu, Simon Johnson, and James A Robinson received the Nobel Prize in Economics for studying how institutions shape prosperity. The Indian laureates include Amartya Sen for his work on welfare economics and Abhijit Banerjee for his experimental approach to alleviating global poverty. The prize, awarded by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, has honored 93 laureates since 1969.
title: Nobel prize 2024: Acemoglu, Johnson & Robinson get economics award

description: Mumbai Police revealed that both NCP leader Baba Siddique and his son Zeeshan were targets in the murder case. Pravin Lonkar has been arrested for sheltering the accused, while his brother Shubuu remains at large. The ossification test confirmed accused Dharmaraj Kashyap's age. Chief Minister Eknath Shinde assured strict action against those responsible.
title: Baba Siddique's son Zeeshan was also a target of killers: Mumbai police

description: In a recent Bigg Boss 18 episode, Vivian Dsena reveals his unique habit of keeping pens used to sign contracts, drawing reactions from fellow contestants. He shares anecdotes about his US Visa interview and offers for reality shows, emphasizing his mother's advice on honesty. Krushna Abhishek, Bharti Singh, and Sudesh Lehri entertain the housemates.
title: BB 18: Why Vivian Dsena didn't return the pen he signed contract with

description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai congratulates Elon Musk as SpaceX successfully catches the 233-foot rocket booster after a test flight. Musk shares the event on social media, showcasing the booster being caught by the launch tower.
title: Google CEO congratulates SpaceX CEO Elon Musk: ‘... I have to admit …’

description: Following a selection overhaul after their loss in the first Test, the Pakistan cricket team, now led by Shan Masood, gears up for a crucial second Test against England in Multan. Key players, including Shaheen Shah Afridi and Babar Azam, have been rested due to form and fitness concerns.
title: Afridi breaks silence after being dropped from Pakistan Test squad

description: The BJP has called for the resignations of Congress leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Karnataka chief minister Siddaramaiah after they returned land allotted to them. BJP spokespersons argue that this move is an admission of guilt and evidence of corruption and misuse of power within the Congress party. The party demands legal action against both leaders.
title: 'Misuse of power': BJP targets Congress after Kharge's son returns land
'For welfare and progress of capital': Delhi CM Atishi meets PM Modi

description: Gautam Gambhir, head coach, underscores the crucial role of bowlers in contemporary Test cricket, highlighting the shift from batter-centric strategies to those prioritizing bowlers. He stresses that bowlers are key to securing victories as overpowering batting alone does not guarantee success in modern-day cricket. Gambhir underlined the necessity of breaking the "obsessed" mentality of batters.
title: This is the era of bowlers, batters only set up matches: Gautam Gambhir

description: India has rejected Canada's diplomatic claims labeling its high commissioner as a 'person of interest' in an investigation. The Indian Ministry of External Affairs called these allegations baseless and politically motivated, accusing Canadian Prime Minister Trudeau of using anti-India rhetoric to gain political support domestically.
title: 'Trudeau’s hostility has long been in evidence': India's strong response to Canada

description: Bharti Singh's popular cooking-comedy show, Laughter Chefs: Entertainment Unlimited, recently concluded its extended season with a grand finale. Despite its success and fan demand, the return of the show remains uncertain, with potential delays until January 2025. Singh expressed her longing for the show and camaraderie among the cast in her recent vlog.
title: Laughter Chefs: Bharti reveals there isn't any confirmation on show return

description: Both the 2021 Men's and 2024 Women's T20 World Cups were relocated for different reasons. The Indian men's team in 2021 and the women's team in 2024 both faced disappointing campaigns, with semifinal qualifications looking bleak. The UAE has proven challenging for Indian cricket teams in ICC tournaments. India's fate rests on the outcome of the match between New Zealand and Pakistan.
title: T20 World Cup: UAE not a happy hunting ground for Indian cricket teams

description: A cab driver’s list of six rules for passengers, including a request to avoid calling him 'bhaiya,' has sparked a contentious debate online. While some netizens appreciate his demand for respect, others find the rules too stringent. The guidelines also stress the importance of passengers practicing basic manners during the ride.
title: 'Don't call us bhaiya': Cab driver lists rules for passengers goes viral

description: Violence erupted during Gopal Mishra's funeral procession in Bahraich after he was shot during a clash between two communities over DJ music. A mob set several vehicles inside an auto showroom on fire. An FIR has been registered, and police detained 20 to 30 individuals. The situation is now under control, according to authorities.
title: Bahraich violence: Protestors torch shops, hospitals after man killed in clash

description: Google CEO Sundar Pichai outlined the traits sought in job applicants, emphasizing technical proficiency and a zeal for learning and adaptability. He highlighted the benefits of in-person collaboration and the company's free meal policy, noting how these enhance creativity and community. Almost 90% of job offers are accepted, underscoring Google's appeal.
title: Sundar Pichai on what Google looks for in ‘superstar software engineers’

description: Gautam Gambhir, celebrating his 43rd birthday, is renowned for key performances in ICC finals and notable on-field altercations driven by his competitive nature. These include heated exchanges with Andre Neil, Shahid Afridi, Virat Kohli, and Kamran Akmal, highlighting his intense passion for cricket.
title: Watch: Gautam Gambhir’s top 5 intense confrontations

description: India's chances to reach the Women's T20 World Cup semifinals hinge on the outcome of the final group game between Pakistan and New Zealand. If Pakistan wins, India will advance due to their superior net run rate. Indian cricketer Mona Meshram expresses confidence in Pakistan's victory, urging them to defeat New Zealand.
title: Exclusive: 'Entire India will cheer for Pakistan'

description: Gunjan Tilak Raj Soni has resigned as an independent director at Zomato due to increased work commitments. Soni, currently CEO of Zalora Group, previously held roles at Myntra, Jabong, and McKinsey.
title: Zomato's independent director steps down': Read her 'resignation email'

description: A 17-year-old student, son of Deputy Commissioner of Police Shilwant Nandedkar, committed suicide by hanging himself at his home in Chhatrapati Sabhajinagar. He left a note declaring his enjoyment of life and intentions to start again. Authorities are investigating to understand the reasons behind this tragic incident.
title: 'Enjoyed my life': DCP's son ends his life, leaves suicide note on mirror

description: Australia's women's team once again overcame India in a crucial, low-scoring T20 World Cup match, defeating them by nine runs. Harmanpreet Kaur's valiant efforts couldn't secure a victory, leaving India dependent on Pakistan for semi-final qualification.
title: How India women lost the plot against Australia

description: N Chandrasekaran, Chairman of Tata Sons, pays tribute to Ratan Tata's legacy, highlighting his humanity, keen memory, and visionary leadership. Tata, who transformed Tata Group into a global giant, was known for his compassion towards employees and even stray dogs at Bombay House.
title: 'Where will dogs go ... ': Chandrasekaran shares unheard stories of Ratan Tata

description: Hoax bomb threat messages disrupted three international flights of two Indian carriers on Monday, affecting nearly 600 passengers. Authorities diverted an Air India flight to Delhi and delayed two IndiGo flights for thorough security checks. Aviation officials confirmed the threats were hoax, and the Bureau of Civil Aviation Security proposes adding offenders to a no-fly list for five years.
title: False scare: Hundreds of flyers affected by fake bomb threats on 3 international flights

description: At Tesla's 'We, Robot' event, CEO Elon Musk introduced Optimus, a humanoid robot capable of serving drinks and playing games. However, attendee Robert Scoble revealed that the robots were remote-controlled by humans and not fully autonomous.
title: How Tesla robots that served drinks and sang Happy Birthday were 'not machines'

description: Babar Azam was dropped for Pakistan's second Test against England following an innings defeat in the first Test. Former England captain Michael Vaughan criticized the decision. Other key players, including Shaheen Afridi, Naseem Shah, and Sarfaraz Ahmed, were also dropped to help them regain form and confidence.  Babar, who recently stepped down as Pakistan’s white-ball captain, has faced criticism for his underwhelming form with the bat.
title: Ex-Eng captain slams Pakistan for dropping Babar Azam
Jeddah-bound IndiGo flight receives bomb threat, aircraft taken to isolated bay

description: Former Maharashtra minister Baba Siddique was assassinated in Bandra despite Y-category security. The murder, linked to gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, involved months of surveillance by Dharmaraj Kashyap, Shivkumar Gautam, and Gurnail Singh. Police captured two suspects, while one remains at large. Security lapses and Bishnoi's alleged Dawood connections are under scrutiny.
title: Pepper spray, firecrackers and a plan: How Baba Siddique’s assassination was carried out

description: Hina Khan, battling stage three breast cancer, shares her journey of chemotherapy and its side effects through social media. Despite her struggle with neuropathic pain and hair loss, she finds motivation in small victories like her last remaining eyelash. Hina continues to inspire many with her resilience and commitment.
title: Hina Khan pens a motivational note as she shares pictures of losing eyelashes

description: Chelsie Baham won 'Big Brother' Season 26, taking home the $750,000 prize, while Tucker Des Lauriers was voted viewers' favorite houseguest, earning $50,000. The finale featured significant surprises, including a historic first with Julie Chen Moonves missing an episode due to COVID.
title: Big Brother 26: Cheslie Baham lifts the trophy and takes home $750,000

description: Indian cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar achieved his first double century in Test cricket during New Zealand's 1999 tour to India in the 3rd Test at Ahmedabad. Tendulkar's remarkable 217 and Sourav Ganguly's 125 led India to declare at 583/7, eventually helping India win the series 1-0. It was the then Indian captain's 71st match (110th innings).
title: When Sachin Tendulkar scored his maiden double hundred in Test cricket

description: Uttar Pradesh minister Sanjay Singh Gangwar claimed that lying in a cowshed and cleaning it can cure cancer, while stroking a cow's back can lower blood pressure. At the inauguration of the Kanha gaushala, Gangwar also suggested celebrating personal events at gaushalas and urged Muslims to celebrate Eid with cow's milk.
title: Lying in cowshed, cleaning it can cure cancer, claims UP minister

description: Despite an impressive Test debut against England, Sarfaraz Khan awaits a spot in India's playing XI. Former selector Jatin Paranjape emphasizes the competition for batting positions and advises Sarfaraz to stay in form and bide his time. Sarfaraz remains in contention for future series, including the Border Gavaskar Trophy in Australia.
title: 'Nothing unfair about Sarfaraz Khan situation'

description: An armed man, Vem Miller, was arrested near Trump's Coachella rally but denies assassination intentions, claiming to be a Trump supporter. He asserts that the firearms were for personal protection due to past threats. Fake IDs found with him were explained as legitimate documents for safety reasons.
title: '100% Trump supporter': Man held with loaded guns denies assassination intent
New York-bound Air India flight diverted to Delhi after bomb threat

description: Former MLA Baba Siddique was shot outside his son's office in Bandra East. Assailants fled through a Durga Puja procession, neutralizing Siddique's police guard with pepper spray. Police apprehended two suspects in a nearby park, seizing automatic pistols and magazines. A case has been registered.
title: Baba Siddique's assailants were mistaken for mobile thieves as they fled the spot

description: On Saturday, former Maharashtra minister Baba Siddique was shot and killed by three unidentified men in Mumbai. His last rites were performed by his children Zeeshan and Arshia, with many celebrities in attendance. Two suspects have been arrested in connection with the case.
title: Baba Siddique Funeral: Sana Khan, Shehnaaz Gill and others pay their last respects

description: China conducted extensive military drills near Taiwan, termed a 'stern warning' against Taiwanese independence. The exercises respond to Taiwan's refusal to acknowledge itself as part of China. Taiwan's defense ministry denounced the drills as provocations and stated its readiness to respond.
title: China flexes military muscle near Taiwan, in warning over independence

description: Former President Donald Trump suggested the potential need for military intervention on Election Day to address internal threats. He dismissed concerns about unrest from his supporters but highlighted worries about 'radical left lunatics' and external agitators, suggesting the National Guard or military might be necessary.
title: Will US have peaceful elections? Trump warns of 'very bad, sick people'

description: Nasa unveils its strategy to counter potential catastrophic asteroids, drawing lessons from the dinosaur extinction event. Plans include deploying spacecraft or nuclear solutions to intercept and deflect threatening NEOs. A successful DART mission in 2022 highlights Nasa's capability to redirect hazardous asteroids.
title: Spacecraft army or nukes? Nasa reveals strategy against 'planet killer' asteroids

description: Cameron Green will miss Australia's five-Test series against India due to a spine injury requiring surgery. The 25-year-old is expected to be out for six months, missing the Sri Lanka tour and ICC Champions Trophy. His absence impacts Australia's bowling options and batting depth.
title: Cameron Green ruled out of Border-Gavaskar Trophy

description: In Sanjeevraopet village, Sangareddy district, two individuals have died while nearly 100 others fell ill due to suspected water contamination. A dog's carcass found in a local well may be the source. Though locals believe the deaths are linked to contaminated water, officials have yet to confirm. Thirty patients remain hospitalized.
title: Foul water? 2 die, 100 fall ill in Telangana after dog dies in well

description: Two men accused in the Gauri Lankesh murder case received a hero's welcome in Vijayapura, Karnataka, after being granted bail following seven years in jail. Sri Ram Sene members honored Parashuram Waghmore and Manohar Yadawe, who later performed religious rituals and avoided media interaction.
title: Clip of hero's welcome for 2 accused of killing Lankesh goes viral

description: A violent clash over DJ music during Durga idol immersion in Mehsi Maharajganj led to the death of Ramgopal Mishra, inciting vandalism and arson. Heavy police deployment, including PAC forces, has been made to control the escalating tension amid suspended immersions in Bahraich and nearby areas.
title: Violent clash over DJ music at Durga immersion turns deadly in UP

description: Hezbollah released an audio recording of its slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, urging fighters to defend Lebanon, following his death by an Israeli air strike. Amid escalating tensions, a drone attack injured 20 in Israel, and the US is sending an anti-missile system to support Israel. The UAE launched an aid campaign for Lebanon.
title: Hezbollah airs audio of slain leader Nasrallah killed in Israeli strike

description: India's Women's T20 World Cup semifinal hopes hinge on Pakistan's performance against New Zealand. If Pakistan wins, India advances due to a higher net run rate. Otherwise, New Zealand secures the final semifinal spot. Australia remains undefeated and qualifies from Group A. A victory for Pakistan would clear the path for India to advance to the semifinals.
title: Why India is praying for a Pakistan win?

description: India, led by Harmanpreet Kaur, faced a narrow defeat against Australia in the ICC Women's T20 World Cup, putting their semi-final hopes at risk. Despite Harmanpreet's valiant 54, India finished their chase at 142/9. However, they still have a chance to progress, depending on the outcome of New Zealand vs Pakistan.
title: Can India still reach the World Cup semi-finals?

description: Reliance Jio has requested the Indian government to conduct a transparent auction for satellite spectrum, countering TRAI's proposed 'first come first served' methodology. Highlighting competition from global entities like Starlink and Amazon Kuiper, Jio seeks fair spectrum assignment to ensure parity with terrestrial networks.
title: Reliance Jio sends 'complaint letter' to telecom minister Jyotiraditya Scindia

description: The United States is deploying its advanced THAAD anti-missile system to Israel to bolster its air defenses amid escalating tensions with Iran. The deployment, authorized by Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, follows missile attacks on Israel by Iran in April and October, involving US troops for operational support.
title: US to send THAAD defense battery system & troops to Israel: Know more about this

description: Arfeen Khan and Karan Veer Mehra engage in a heated discussion about Mehra's personality traits, with Khan suggesting he has aggressive tendencies. Mehra defends himself, denying any violent behavior despite his past hardships, including two divorces. The conversation is spurred by comments made during the Khatron Ke Khiladi 14 Grand Premiere.
title: Bigg Boss 18: Karan clarifies after Arfeen's statement, says never raised hand on ex-wives

description: West Rajasthan, the driest region in India's plains, received excess rainfall this monsoon, continuing a trend of higher-than-normal rainfall for the past two decades. IMD data reveals that the region has experienced above-normal or excess rainfall in 12 of the last 20 years, signaling potential shifts in monsoon patterns due to climate change.
title: For 20 years, Thar getting more rain than normal

description: Over 50 protesters, including women, were detained near Ladakh Bhawan in New Delhi as they showed silent support for climate activist Sonam Wangchuk's hunger strike. Wangchuk's fast aims to include Ladakh in the Sixth Schedule of the Constitution for tribal protections. Police noted the protest lacked permission and released most detainees shortly after.
title: Cops end silent protest in Sonam Wangchuk's support

description: Dalit activist Daulat Kunwar reveals ongoing caste discrimination in Indian prisons. Following a Supreme Court order invalidating colonial-era prison rules, hope emerges for improved treatment. The ruling, hailed by UP’s DGP, demands reforms to end caste-driven labor. Activists emphasize the need for societal change and strict compliance to ensure equality in prisons.
title: Caste-based labour & limited food: Dalits recount jail horror

description: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for October 14, 2024. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.
title: Horoscope today: Read your astrological predictions
